name: Evan King

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: Well, holy shit! You're back!

topics.topic_text: It's done, Evan. The Family will never bother Arefu again.
topics.response_text: I don't know how you did it, but goddamn am I glad you walked up that ramp and lent us a hand.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, I took care of your problem.
topics.response_text: I don't know how you did it, but goddamn am I glad you walked up that ramp and lent us a hand.

topics.topic_text: The Family's been dealt with and you owe me big.
topics.response_text: If I had two caps to rub together, I'd still give them to you. Afraid I'm as poor as a Brahmin herder though.

topics.topic_text: No, he wasn't with the Family. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Damn. Well maybe he just made a run for Megaton or something. Hope you can find him one day.

topics.topic_text: Sorry, but Ian's dead. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: Damn. That poor kid.

topics.topic_text: He's fine. He's living with Lucy now. <Lie.>
topics.response_text: You're just full of surprises today, aren't you?

topics.topic_text: Who did you think I was?
topics.response_text: I thought you were one of the Family. They're some lowlife gangers who've been giving us a hell of a lot of trouble lately.

topics.topic_text: Let me guess, you thought I was from the Family.
topics.response_text: Wait... you aren't one of them but you know about them? What's going on here?

topics.topic_text: Well, I have this letter for the West Family.
topics.response_text: That's great, but I got bigger problems than being the town post office right now.

topics.topic_text: I'm just passing through.
topics.response_text: Nobody just passes through here. There's nothing to get to by way of this shithole. You've found yourself at a dead-end.

topics.topic_text: Next time you shoot at me like that, you'd better not miss.
topics.response_text: Don't play tough with me. I was shooting my gun when you were still an itch in your daddy's pants!

topics.topic_text: What kind of trouble?
topics.response_text: Well at first they'd do typical gang bullshit. You know, break stuff and make lots of noise, but they always kept their distance.

topics.topic_text: Are they Raiders or Slavers?
topics.response_text: No way. If they were, you'd be staring at a burned out ghost town. I think the Family are just a bunch of punks.

topics.topic_text: Oh come on, it's just gang nonsense.
topics.response_text: That's what I thought at first.

topics.topic_text: Why don't you fight back?
topics.response_text: Yeah sure. I'll just go and take all of them out by myself. What are you, crazy?

topics.topic_text: What's got you so spooked?
topics.response_text: Sigh. Look... you can call me crazy if you want but there just is something odd about those creeps.

topics.topic_text: You ever take one of them out?
topics.response_text: Are you out of your mind? I drop one of them and the rest will use me as a bullet catcher.

topics.topic_text: What are you, some kind of a wimp?
topics.response_text: Look, pal. If you think I'm gonna get my ass shot off playing the hero, you're dead wrong.

topics.topic_text: I'd be glad to help. What do you need?
topics.response_text: I don't want to take my eyes off the ramp here. There's no telling when the Family will return.

topics.topic_text: Help costs caps.
topics.response_text: Do I look like I just stepped out of Tenpenny Tower? I barely have a pot to piss in.

topics.topic_text: Sounds like you're pretty screwed. You're on your own.
topics.response_text: Fine. That's what I've come to expect from strangers. Always thinking of themselves.

topics.topic_text: I was hoping to find out what the Family did here.
topics.response_text: At first they just showed up and carried on like a bunch of kids down there by the riverbed, scaring the Brahmin and stuff like that.

topics.topic_text: Look, maybe you better explain what's going on first.
topics.response_text: I'll tell you what's going on... the Family's been bothering our town for weeks.

topics.topic_text: No, I lied. I'm their newest member!
topics.response_text: What the fuck? You liar!

topics.topic_text: Any help you can provide would be appreciated.
topics.response_text: I've been saving up stuff for emergencies in case things with Arefu got tremendously bad.

topics.topic_text: How are things going now?
topics.response_text: Things are much better. We all don't have to stay inside our houses and we sleep much better at night.

topics.topic_text: I have a proposal for you from Vance, the Family's leader.
topics.response_text: Interesting. It seems they wish to enter into some kind of agreement.

topics.topic_text: I have a message for the West family from their daughter.
topics.response_text: I can't take that. You're just going to have to bring it back to Lucy or to Ian if you can find him.

topics.topic_text: This may sound odd, but is there a trainyard outside Arefu?
topics.response_text: Well, yeah actually. Meresti Trainyard almost due east of here.

topics.topic_text: I discovered that the Wests had bite marks on their necks made by a human!
topics.response_text: What!? The Family must be a pack of cannibals!

topics.topic_text: Don't worry, Evan. I'll figure out what happened to the Wests.
topics.response_text: Thanks kid. You're all right.

topics.topic_text: No, I only found the parents' bodies.
topics.response_text: This has to be the work of the Family! I've caught that weirdo leader of theirs talking to Ian down by the river.

topics.topic_text: Nope, and it's unlikely they left him alive.
topics.response_text: What am I gonna do? The Wests' lives were my responsibility and look what happened!

topics.topic_text: No, and enough with the third degree already!
topics.response_text: Sorry... sorry. I just don't know what to do. The West's lives were my responsibility and look what happened!

topics.topic_text: Can you tell me more about what's been going on around here?
topics.response_text: There used to be more families living here. Most of them have dismantled their shacks and moved on to greener pastures.

topics.topic_text: Where do you think I can find the Family?
topics.response_text: I think they live somewhere east or northeast of here. Problem is, they always travel in the dark so I can't see exactly where they go.

topics.topic_text: SpeechChallengeFailure
topics.response_text: Nothing. The Family are just a bunch of damn punks.

conversation.response_text: Next time I see the Family, there's gonna be hell to pay.
I take it you found the place.

description:
Evan King is a 65 year-old Caucasian Male.

Evan King is the aging mayor and sheriff of Arefu, a small settlement in the Capital Wasteland. Having lived in the town his entire life, he has witnessed its gradual decline from thirty residents to just five. Despite the dwindling population and constant threats from raiders and other dangers, King remains fiercely protective of his remaining townspeople, going so far as to demolish half of the settlement's bridge to prevent attacks from the north.

Evan King's Personality: Determined, protective, weary but resilient. Evan King carries the heavy burden of leadership with quiet dignity, though the years of defending Arefu have left him tired and pragmatic. He values safety above all else but is willing to compromise when it serves his people's interests.

Evan King's Backstory: Evan King was born and raised in Arefu, a settlement established shortly after the Great War. He has spent his entire life in this small community, watching as it gradually lost population to raiders, disease, and the harsh realities of the wasteland. As the town's oldest and most experienced resident, he naturally assumed the roles of both mayor and sheriff, becoming its primary defender. King has witnessed countless threats to Arefu over the decades, developing a pragmatic approach to survival that sometimes puts him at odds with his remaining townspeople. In recent years, he has been particularly concerned about the growing influence of The Family gang, a group of vampires operating nearby who have begun preying on travelers passing through Arefu.
